result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan L Matson

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:00 PM Defendant Ryan L Matson in court.  Attorney John Paul Holevoet appeared by video for Ryan L Matson.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls tracking 22TR308 and 22TR309. Deputy Jacob Colassaco sworn in and testifies. Witness identified the defendant. State rests. Cross examination of the witness by the defense. Defense rests. State recalls Deputy Colassaco regarding the blood lab results. No cross examination by defense. Court takes judicial notice of prior convictions. State speaks to the case. Court finds probable cause. Bound over for arraignment on an information. State to e-file information in court and provides copies to defense. Defense waives formal reading of information. Not guilty pleas entered by court. Court requests defense to file a bond modification. Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:32 AM Defendant Ryan L Matson in court.  Attorney John Paul Holevoet appeared by video for Ryan L Matson.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint. Waive reading. Waive time limits. Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 002279,
Payable Number: 77952,
Receipt Number: 22R 003273,
Amount: $20.00

9:52 AM Defendant Ryan L Matson in court without counsel.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls all 22tr309 and 22TR308. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and acknowledges it.  Defendant speaks about retaining counsel. Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:56 AM Defendant Ryan L Matson in court.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received complaint.  Defendant still looking at retaining counsel.  Court continues bond.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant appears in court without counsel. ADA Brown appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant received complaint. Court adjourns initial appearance to June 6th at 10:30 am to allow time for counsel. bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises, Upon release you must wear a SCRAM alcohol monitor 24/7 and follow all directives.

1:36 PM Defendant Ryan L Matson in court, in custody without counsel.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears by video from the Vilas County Jail without counsel.  DA Karl Hayes appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of criminal complaint.  Defendant states he will seek his own counsel.  Bond set at $1,500 cash bond with conditions: Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises, Upon release you must wear a SCRAM alcohol monitor 24/7 and follow all directives. Bond form.
Initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
